com.djrapitops.plan.system.webserver.cache

Class ResponseCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.djrapitops.plan.system.webserver.cache.ResponseCache

  • public class ResponseCache
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the page cache.

    It caches all Responses with their matching identifiers. This reduces CPU cycles and the time to wait for loading the pages. This is especially useful in situations where multiple clients are accessing the server.

    • Method Detail

      • loadResponse

        public static Response loadResponse(java.lang.String identifier,
                                    java.util.function.Supplier<Response> loader)
        Loads the response from the response cache.

        If the Response isn't cached, Supplier.get() in the loader is called to create the Response.

        If the Response is created, it's automatically cached.

        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the page
        loader - The The Response Supplier (How should it load the page if it's not cached)
        Returns:
        The Response that was cached or created by the the Response Supplier

      • loadResponse

        public static Response loadResponse(java.lang.String identifier)
        Loads the page from the page cache.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the page
        Returns:
        The Response that was cached or null if it wasn't

      • cacheResponse

        public static void cacheResponse(java.lang.String identifier,
                                 java.util.function.Supplier<Response> loader)
        Puts the page into the page cache.

        If the cache already inherits that identifier, it's renewed.

        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the page
        loader - The Response Supplier (How it should load the page)

      • isCached

        public static boolean isCached(java.lang.String identifier)
        Checks if the page is cached.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the page
        Returns:
        true if the page is cached

      • clearCache

        public static void clearCache()
        Clears the cache from all its contents.
